results.title: Veneering by the caul method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Four-piece veneer decoration of a panel. The film demonstrates: drawing the design on paper in actual size, making a template and cutting the veneers, laying it down on paper, use of the veneer hammer, transferring to the panel, cramping, removing the paper base and cleaning-up
results.description:

results.title: From forest to timber yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Film opens with a short description, aided by diagrams, of the structure of hard and soft woods followed by a demonstration on the correct way of felling trees, cutting the logs into boards and stacking to dry. The film concludes by listing the woods suitable for different types of work, eg oak and mahogany for cabinet making; pine and fir for carpentry; ash and elm for the wheelwright; and lime and maple for carving.

results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and K. Baron Hartley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.

results.title: Machine operation
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and De Frenes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates correct stroking at speeds ranging from 35 to 180 words per minute. Explains the functions of the various parts of the typewriter and demonstrates the use of these on various types of machines. Demonstrates how to attain correct touch for noiseless, manual, and electric machines.

results.title: Methods
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and De Frenes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates the correct posture for typing and proper fingering of the keys; shows the use of the shift key, back spaces, tabulator, carriage return lever, and other parts on both manual and electric machines; also discusses the funtion of various fixtures on the machine. Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.

results.title: Television receivers
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Diagrams and live action are used to identify the sections of the receiver circuit and to summarise the functions of the receiver. Explains the specific functions of each section in a typical intercarrier sound receiver circuit, from the antenna and transmission line to the picture tube.

results.title: Television system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Explains the principles of television broadcasting, from the camera tube at the studio to the receiver. Shows how the image is brokenm down into picture elements, clarifies the procedure of interfacing; explains the function of each component of the video signal, shows how the scanning raster is produced and the image reproduced in shades of black and white on the screen.
results.description:
